comment.text:
I was just in Atlanta for the 2023 Peach Bowl and a bunch of us ate here after the game.  WOW!  Delicious.  I ordered the Spicy Anna's Seafood Noodle Soup and it was by far one of the best decisions and selections I've made in a while. Beyond delicious with the best broth I've ever had for a Chinese restaurant.  Get it!  Not a fishy taste or smell at all..  Whenever I return to Atlanta, I'm definitely going there again!

Yum!......

Walked in with a group of 5 at 7pm on a Saturday. No reservation but the wait was only about 7 minutes. Nicely decorated but too upscale. 

Very slow service but the food was good and not overly pricey. Hot n sour soup and potstickers were very good. House special noodles, a pork cutlet and salt n pepper shrimp were delicious. 

I'd be willing to try this spot again but not so n a Saturday night.

Our recent visit to Hsu's was an extraordinary culinary adventure. The centerpiece of our meal, the three-course Peking duck, carved tableside, was a feast for both the eyes and palate. Each course unveiled a new layer of flavor, truly highlighting the chef's mastery in preparing this classic dish.

The ribs and dumplings were also standout dishes, offering a harmonious blend of rich, traditional flavors. Complementing these were the hand-crafted cocktails, which were both innovative and delightful, enhancing our overall dining experience.

The service at Hsu's was exceptional. The staff were not only attentive but also displayed deep knowledge of the menu, guiding us through our choices with expert recommendations. Their warmth and professionalism significantly elevated our dining experience.

The ambiance of Hsu's added to the allure of the evening. It struck a perfect balance between warmth and elegance, creating a welcoming yet sophisticated atmosphere. The tasteful decor, blending traditional and modern elements, provided the ideal backdrop for our memorable meal.

In summary, Hsu's delivered an outstanding dining experience. The combination of exquisite food, stellar service, and a cozy yet chic setting made our visit truly remarkable. I wholeheartedly recommend Hsu's to anyone in search of culinary excellence. A well-deserved five stars!

We went for lunch earlier this week. This is by far the best tasting Chinese food that I've ever had. The service is very good as well and the servers are friendly and helpful. I wish I lived closer so I could go weekly.

Yumm - E. Was in town visiting for the Thanksgiving holiday and yelped chines food. This place was right by our hotel with decent reviews.  It closed at 9 and I was worried that we had to get there way before 9 in order to be seated (considering these other spots in the ATL) but that was not the case. They were seating and greeting people even when we left at around 8:30. 

We were greeted by who I'm assuming was the owner and our server was amazing. Didn't get his name but he was super attentive, made great recommendations. The place is not super fancy, but it reminded me of the old school Bay Area Chinese spots. Simple, authentic with good food.

I ordered egg drop soup, which wasn't on the dinner menu and omg it was sooooo good, thick broth with thick real egg drops. It was lovely and needed on this freezing night. 

We also got the Mongolian beef. It was sweet and great with a ton of onions. I love onions. They could have been grilled a bit more, but they were decent enough. The chow mein.. or was it lo mein? Was really good. It was only the 2 of us and we finished everything. Can't wait to come back!

Great service and great food. Especially if u love Chinese food like me.

Yesterday for lunch I decided to walk a couple blocks and stumbled upon Hsu's. I found myself in a dimly lit, yet ambient Chinese restaurant. I started with the spring rolls. They were delicious and the spicy mustard was one of the hottest yet best I've ever tasted. I love seafood, but I usually stay away from it in Atlanta. I am from the coast and am usually quite picky when it comes to my seafood. I made an exception after seeing a few people enjoying bowls of soup and decided it must be the Spicy Anna's. Spicy Anna's seafood noodle soup was one of the best things I have ever eaten. The broth was rich with flavor, despite not being very thick. The shrimp, scallops and chicken were delightful, and perfectly cooked. The aroma was ridiculous, and the spices were intense without overriding the flavors. The noodles were like a delicious lo mein noodle... savory, and soft. I cannot wait to go back and have it again.
Great food, great service and great atmosphere for years. Atlantas favorite!!! You will be happy you went!!
A friend recommended this spot and it by far was some of the best Chinese food that I have had here in the southeast U.S.
Staff was very nice and attentive. Food was excellent. My friend and I shared our entrees. There were so many things I wanted to try. Very affordable. I will be back!

Was in town for a conference and wanted a quick dinner after a long day. I called ahead to place an order of Lo Mein to-go. The food was ready in about 15 minutes. The portion size was large and the meal was tasty. The Lo Mein comes with chicken, shrimp, and beef. All were cooked well. There weren't many veggies with the noodles but the sauce was good.

Really good Chinese food located downtown. The service was great...waiter checked on us regularly and kept the water glass full. The restaurant has an authentic feel and felt welcoming. Would definitely visit again.

I had a wonderful dinner here. It was just a block from my hotel. It was busy for a Monday night! Great service. Very friendly. The staff all seemed to check on each other's tables as needed which was nice. The food was quite tasty! The spicy basil beef was genuinely nice and spicy which I appreciated. The interior had that classic Chinese restaurant vibe that I like with some specialty decor that gives it some unique charm. If I were in the area again, I'd consider going back. Very tasty.
It's was really good the atmosphere was great and the food was great only thing is it's kinda pricey but it was worth it!
By far the best tasting Chinese food in the downtown hotel district. Great customer service as the staff is attentive right when you walk in the door.

I've been trying to eat here for years. Of the many times I've been in town they have been closed on each time. 

I finally got the try the recently and tried the exceptional looking and highly recommended Mongolian Beef. 

Sadly it was almost excellent but fell short in a very disappointing way. I like my Mongolian Beef slightly spicy and a touch of sweet 

Their beef is over sweet. It's as if they coat it in a sugar, granulated sugar. 

The egg rolls were ok as well. In my opinion not worth the high price.
Probably some of the best Asian inspired cuisine I have had.  We had a table of 7 on a very busy night and drinks, food and service was on point. Highly recommend.
Food was delicious, great service! Owner or manager was very friendly and welcoming. Definitely go back if I go to Atlanta again.

Amazing service and great food! Owner came by and said hello and made sure that we were taken care of.
10/10

I was disappointed at the lunch special, having read the great reviews. I ordered the spicy basil beef lunch special. It had good snow peapods, as the menu described. But there were no straw mushrooms and it was not topped with crushed roasted peanuts, just some carrot curls that weren't on the menu. The beef was supposed to have been marinated in 7 spices but I tasted no evidence of that. Three tasty mouthfuls contained Thai basil leaves, but the rest were pretty tasteless.

Ambiance is wonderful, no wait time, staff has been super kind. Lunch was good. I'm from Texas so I was hoping for a larger portion but it was Lunch what can I say. Good food, nice atmosphere, great service.

photos.caption: So far so good, the staff has been excellent. I will let y'all know how the food is...

comment.text: I ordered the a spicy basil chicken and a sweet tea. Dish is SUPER AVERAGE. Like you can get this at any Chinese Carry-out for $15. This was $24. Some of the chicken slices were very rubbery.

photos.caption: Spicy Basil Chicken (Blah-zay) Rice  Sweet Tea

comment.text: I want to give it a better rating but the food was just ok. Our Peking duck was drowned in hoisin sauce, too much gravy/sauce in the pan fried noodles and our steamed fish was over cooked. Maybe I'm a bit critical.

One of the best Chinese restaurants I've ever been to anywhere! The crab Rangoons were drab and delicious, you can tell made in house.  The bartender, who was amazing by the way, recommended the string beans with shrimp.  I never would've ordered it, so glad i did, i couldn't get enough! Highly recommend going out of your way to check it out if your in atlanta even for a day.

Hsu offered us impeccable service but more importantly we found someone who could make our favorite recipe of Honey Walnut Shrimp! 
All I can say is it was perfect! Not many places get this one right. Our waiter was also considerate of us asking for a quieter seat so we could hear each other talk.
Good food. I had the pineapple fried rice and calamari. They didn't disappoint. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

Quick service, friendly & efficient; super flavorful Chinese food; love grabbing takeout when downtown
Busy, but warm & cozy ambiance

So I discovered this mom and pop Chinese place while here on work... The food is good but the atmosphere is way better.... I decided to sit at the bar we had 4 total strangers sitting next to each other and by the entree we where all laughing and acting like friends the Bartender Kenny ... Was worth every penny spent here. I have never laughed so hard. Like I said the food was good but the humor was awesomr. The hot and sour soup was good but the tso chicken extra Krispy no veggies more chicken extra sauce. The flavor is spicy but not to spicy it also has a kick. 

But seriously come sit at the bar and have dinner with Kenny totally worth it and his sassy attitude.. what else can I say except go try it

I'm a big fan of hot and sour soup and Hsu's is probably the best I've ever tasted.

They are about two blocks from where I work so I usually walk to them to avoid the delivery fees.  There is a bike lane in front of the location and usually there are a couple of cars parked there to pick up orders. 

If you choose to dine in there is a parking deck next to the restaurant and they will validate parking for that deck. They are open for lunch from 11:30am to 2. They reopen at 5pm for dinner and close at 9.

I've only had the seafood hot and sour soup. It has shrimp and scallops. The cost is just about $9. 

Consistently the soup has only two shrimp and about six scallops. It's soup so it's hard to tell when the seafood is added, but since I've never had more than two shrimp in the soup. While I don't expect it to be all seafood, the amount of shrimp is a little disappointing. 

The hot and sour soup is available without seafood for just about $4. 

Very nice staff and great service. They'd probably earn 5 stars if I'd eaten inside and tried anything but the soup. 

I'll definitely return.

photos.caption: Celebrity photo wall. RIP Betty White

comment.text:
Hsu's Atlanta is a popular place to go to for Chinese food located in the heart of Downtown Atlanta . The food here is always good and I have literally come her since I was seven with my mother. she would often take me to work and after I helped her , I would be rewarded with the delicious foods Hsus has to offer.Her favorite dish was the schezwan style string beans and I loved it as a kid as well due to its crunchy texture from the string beans mixed with juicy ground beef and the schezwan spices that gives the dish a great balance with a kick .My favorite dishes include the jjambbong( Spicy Anna's Seafood Noodle Soup) ,jjajamyun( black bean curd noodles) , mapo tofu , walnut shrimp ,spicy basil chicken and the hot and sour soup. It may sound like the whole menu but yes the food is that good and if my twenty two years of experience doesn't convince you then ask all the famous people that has stopped by like Keanu Reeves , Jeremy Lin and a bunch of other people that have a picture up on their wall. The taste of the food is always consistently good but that's because the same family has been running the restaurant for years. Customer service is always fantastic and the best part is that they don't dump a bunch of msg or sauce on top of their food like most Chinese restaurants in downtown.
If your visiting or you work downtown and you want some delicious Chinese food , Hsus is a restaurant I would highly recommend!

We had to come back during our stay for dragon con as we found this little gem our first year there. The staff is beyond friendly, food is quick and absolutely delicious. We haven't had anything there we haven't liked! And the Sri is for the weekend are always different and amazing too. It's fun to see the celebrity wall (and there have been many)!

Food!  This smallish establishment is churning out some spice and heat.   Gourmet authentic Chinese with plenty of Szechuan character.  Take the pepper score symbols seriously and enjoy! There is something for everyone on the menu.
Hong Kong Chinese with a few nice surprises. Staff are wonderful. Nice retreat from the busyness of downtown.  Complementary parking in the deck above the restaurant.

I've been trying to get to this place for a while now. It's not the most convenient location given the parking options. I got lunch, hot and sour soup & sesame chicken. The soup was good  not great- seemed to have more of a Szechuan flair; chicken broth based with both pork and shrimp. Not the best that had in the Atlanta Metro, but still good. 
The sesame chicken was fantastic, reasonable smaller sized/light portion for lunch - crispy golden brown & a rich and flavorful sauce. 
Their pricing is quite high. Most places in the area include an entree, egg roll, chicken wing & soup for the same cost as Hsu's entree alone. 
I would rate 3.5 stars if Yelp allowed it, I gave the 4th star because of the nice ambiance & efficient staff.

Wanted to try this place for a while, was greeted promptly and seated quickly on a Friday night new year's weekend. It was pretty packed but waiter came quick and was very attentive. I ordered wonton soup as appetizer and scallops as main dish. Soup was very good but scallops were super rubbery, chewy and fatty. Definitely would never order again but maybe come back for a different dish. Fried rice was also good. One small bowl of soup and dumpling appetizer with general tso's chicken and scallops were over $100 so if you're on a budget not the place for you but was pretty good and will probably try again in the future.

This place is a gem! Second time I visit Atlanta, and I had to eat here again. Definitely will not disappoint! I've tried a few dishes and can't even say what I liked more. the green beans with chicken was pretty amazing but all the food tasted great. The atmosphere is quit, cozy, and on the classy side. I'm talking real chop sticks, a candle light at every table, and white cloth table covers. The waiters are amazing at customer service and are more than happy to suggest the best dishes. 
I recommend to all.
Very good Szechuan food in a convivial atmosphere. Good spring rolls and people watching. I did takeout (string beans), and they were very friendly and helpful. Solid food with some big-city fun.

Great food and ambiance! We ordered the String Beans Szechwan Style with Ground Pork and Mongolian Beef, both were amazing! String beans were exactly what I was looking for, crunchy and ground pork a little spicy. Mongolian beef was very tender and loved the sweet sauce. The only thing I have a small complaint is that this dish is half green onions, not a lot of meat. 8/10 for both dishes!

photos.caption: String Beans Szechwan Style with Ground Pork

comment.text: Food was average.  Close proximity to the downtown area, so definitely convenient. Ggggggg

There are not many restaurant choices in downtown area. Hsu's would be an average chinese restaurant if it was located somewhere else. Foods are okay, service is good. It would be a 5 star if they didn't suggest tips based on after tax amounts. That's is deceptive.
On vacation here and thought I'd give this restaurant a try & I'm so glad we did!!!! It was so delicious and the lunch portions were big for the price. 10/10 would recommend! Absolutely delicious

photos.caption: Tso chicken, fried rice, chicken lomein, and Fried Sesame Chicken

comment.text:
Walked in during the evening. We got lucky because soon after a few parties came in after us. As far as the ambiance it's very quiet! I feel we were kind of whispering a little to keep our conversation private lol. Not a bad thing. Very family friendly. The establishment is very clean, the customer service was great as well. I feel the owner, and staff were good at making sure the food was prepared well, and tasty for us. 

I have to say the food tastes very fresh. The price point is a tiny bit up there for Chinese. However, it's worth it. I ordered the honey walnut shrimp, and crab wontons (which are listed on the menu as something else).. can't remember the name. My 11 y/o daughter ordered won ton soup, and the house lomein minus the beef. Everything was really good, however I wasn't too impressed with the wontons.

I believe there's an automatic gratuity tax on the bill. The menu is short, and sweet making it very easy to order your food. I highly recommend this place, and will definitely be coming back.

Great Chinese restaurant. Came here with some colleagues. Had a reservation for 8 people which dwindled down to 6. The owner was very accommodating. We ordered a bunch of food to share. The Mongolian beef, General tsos chicken, ginger black bean salmon were very delicious. The seafood got and sour soup was good too. When we left the restaurant I noticed all the celebrity photos on the wall. So many famous people have eaten here,  athletes,  movie stars,  politicians. Keanu reeves and Paul walker have both eaten here! Anyway,  cool spot.

Chang C from Knoxville wrote a review about the pricing being unfair between the menu with Chinese descriptions and the one without Chinese writing... stating the menu with Chinese writing was higher priced.  

Please note the menus were different because one was a DINNER MENU (the higher priced one with Chinese descriptions while the other was a LUNCH MENU.  

It's not unusual at all for a restaurant to offer lower prices at lunch as portions are generally smaller.

I've been going to this restaurant for over 20 years and know the owners to be genuinely kind and caring folks who would never knowingly rip-off any group of people. 

I find the food and service to be as excellent today as it was the first time I dined with them.  BTW, if you don't love the food they bring out alert the wait staff immediately and they will make it right for you.  That's been my experience.
Service and food was great. Would recommend to others. Ambiance is neat to see all the stars who have visited.

Excellent food and service, accommodated our large group last minute 
Walnut shrimp is my new favorite
Good foods, service is lousy. If bring in your own bottle, they charge $35 each for opening fee.

I don't normally go to Asian restaurants when I am traveling, but HSU's was highly recommended to me. We took a group of 5 and we all really loved our dinners. 
The waitress that we had (don't remember her name) was wonderful. She recommended items and really added to our dining experience.

Great chinese in downtown Atlanta.

Big portions, service was great, food was tasty and fresh not greasy. So good we went back twice for our final meal in Atlanta. 

We also had the combination fried rice.

photos.caption: General Tsu's Favorite Chicken Jumbo Shrimp with Ginger and Scallion

comment.text: Stopped by for dinner on a Saturday and was able to get seated quickly. The restaurant can get crowded so it was a little noisy. The service was good and incredibly quick. We ordered and the food came out in about 10-15 minutes. The prices are a little high but it was about the same I've seen across Atlanta, the portions were big and it was good to be able to take a box home for lunch. The flavor was great and pineapple fried rice has become one of my new favorite dishes. The pork was a little dry, but I would totally come back

photos.caption: Pineapple Fried Rice with Shrimp and Pork

comment.text:
I wanted Chinese food while visiting Atlanta, so we found this restaurant. 

Lovely atmosphere; lovely owners. 

Had a few different people serving us. Service was a little slow at first. 

We shared the Mongolian Beef -- very tasty!

Definitely an authentic Chinese dining experience.
